body.p:
G. W. NORTON, President.
M. B. MORTON, Cashier.
Southern Bank of Kentucky,
Russellville, 17 March 1862

To His Excellency
Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Ky.
Dear Sir:

Many of our citizens are anxious for the appointment of Dreury W. Poor as Magistrate for this district to fill the vacancy occasioned by the death of Alexr. Hull Esqr. I take pleasure in saying that Mr. Poor is an excellent upright citizen and in my opinion, will make a good magistrate. I trust you will confer the appointment on him.

Very Truly & Respy, Your
